content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(words::Vector{String}, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = join(words[1:min(length(words), text_width)])
    for i in (text_width + 1):length(words)
        if length(current_line) + length(words[i]) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = words[i]
        else
            current_line = join([current_line, " ", words[i]])
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return lines
end

words = ["The", "quick", "brown", "fox", "jumps", "over", "the", "lazy", "dog"]
wrap_string(words)
```

This function takes a vector of words and an optional text width parameter. It iterates over the words, adding them to a current line until the line exceeds the specified text width. At that point, it adds
